channel.title: digitallyOBSESSED.com DVD Reviews
channel.description: The most comprehensive and entertaining DVD Reviews

item.title: Teenage Cavegirl
item.description: From: Retromedia - Year: 2004 - Rated: Not Rated - Release Date: November 16, 2004 Attractive nude women and nearly-explicit sex are the selling points here. As much as I love Fred Olen Ray, I can only see how this might serve to pass the time on late night pay-cable, not necessarily as something that someone might actually seek and out and purchase. That's another story entirely. Amazon Compare

item.title: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
item.description: From: Warner Home Video - Year: 2004 - Rated: PG - Release Date: November 23, 2004 - Features: Anamorphic * Widescreen * DD 5.1 * - Recommended! Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban is the best of the series thus far, both as a book and as a film, and though the motion picture adaptation isn't perfect, it accurately captures the feel of the narrative better than previous installments. It also happily dispenses with the methodical storytelling and cringe-inducing, syrupy sweetness that made the Chris Columbus-helmed pictures such a chore to sit through. The DVD also qualifies as the best yet in terms of both video quality and extras. Amazon Compare

item.title: The Frank Sinatra Show with Ella Fitzgerald
item.description: From: Music Video Distributors - Year: 1957 - Rated: Not Rated - Release Date: November 16, 2004 It's not all the Frank and Ella you could ask for, and the technical values are subpar, but when Sinatra and Fitzgerald sing, separately or together, all's right with the world. Amazon Compare

item.title: Zhou Yu's Train (Zhou Yu de huo che)
item.description: From: Columbia TriStar Home Video - Year: 2002 - Rated: PG-13 - Release Date: November 23, 2004 - Features: Anamorphic * Widescreen * DD 5.1 * - Recommended! Zhou Sun's romantic triangle is visually stunning, but suffers from a fragmented plot that doesn't bother to explain or develop its characters. A disappointment. If you want an effective work, look to the films of Wong Kar-Wai, such as the marvelous <a href="showreview.php3?ID=2918">In the Mood for Love</a>. Columbia's disc delivers fine a/v quality, sans the extras. Amazon Compare

item.title: O Genio: Ray Charles Live in Brazil 1963
item.description: From: Rhino - Year: 1963 - Rated: Not Rated - Release Date: November 16, 2004 - Features: Extras! * - Recommended! If you only have enough dough to spend on one of the handful of Ray Charles concert DVDs on the market today, O Genio: Ray Charles Live in Brazil 1963 is the one worthy enough to slap down those hard earned greenbacks for; I can't think of a better way to honor his memory (other than Jamie Foxx picking up the gold on Oscar night). A "must-have" for any serious student of classic R & B and fans of the man himself. Amazon Compare

item.title: Looney Tunes Golden Collection Volume 2
item.description: From: Warner Home Video - Year: Various - Rated: Not Rated - Release Date: November 02, 2004 - Features: Extras! * - Recommended! Not content to rest on their laurels, Warner outdoes themselves with excellent restorations, good transfers and a daunting quantity of extra material. The only complaint is the inattention to the proper flagging, which spoils the effect of a few shorts. Amazon Compare

item.title: The Andy Griffith Show: The Complete First Season
item.description: From: Paramount Studios - Year: 1960 - Rated: G - Release Date: November 16, 2004 The Andy Griffith Show is wonderful for the whole family to enjoy. While some parts are a little dated, on the whole the entertainment value is high. And while the best of the show is yet to come, this first season holds a wealth of great episodes, and Paramount has given us a very nice presentation quality. Amazon Compare

item.title: The Hebrew Hammer
item.description: From: Comedy Central Home Video - Year: 2003 - Rated: R - Release Date: November 16, 2004 - Features: Anamorphic * Widescreen * DD 5.1 * Extras! * - Recommended! I was schvitzing while writing this review, torn over whether or not I actually liked it. There are moments that are incredibly funny, while others are lame retreads of other films that have done this sort of thing better. In the end, it is a decent rental. Amazon Compare

item.title: The Pickle
item.description: From: Columbia TriStar Home Video - Year: 1993 - Rated: R - Release Date: November 16, 2004 - Features: Anamorphic * Widescreen * Extras! * - Recommended! If it's one of those days where rain thwarts your plans, there's nothing around the house to take care of and you just have to have something to watch, The Pickle should satisfy your Hollywood hunger pains. However, patient viewers are more apt to forgive its rough spots, so if you have a low tolerance for lulls and such, you may want to think twice, even as a rental. Amazon Compare

item.title: Richard Pryor: I Ain't Dead Yet, #*%$#@!! - Uncensored!
item.description: From: Comedy Central Home Video - Year: 2003 - Rated: Not Rated - Release Date: November 16, 2004 - Features: Extras! * Comedy Central's DVD release of Richard Pryor: I Ain't Dead Yet, #*%$#@!! - Uncensored! is a rare release, because the extras are better than the feature. Accompanying the extras are good image and sound transfers, even if they aren't incredibly impressive. A better investment of money would be audio recordings of Pryor's act. Amazon Compare

item.title: Max & Ruby's Christmas
item.description: From: Paramount Studios - Year: 2004 - Rated: Not Rated - Release Date: October 26, 2004 A gentle bunch of stories about sibling rivalry featuring happy endings and little discord. Do the bunny hop over to the DVD player and check it out. Amazon Compare

item.title: The Marx Brothers Silver Screen Collection (Duck Soup, Horse Feathers, Monkey Business, Animal Crackers, The Cocoanuts)
item.description: From: Universal Studios Home Video - Year: 1929-33 - Rated: G - Release Date: November 09, 2004 If these movies don't make you laugh, check your pulse, because all these decades later, this quintet of pictures from the earliest days of sound remain among the best and funniest screen comedies of all time. I'm partial to Duck Soup, myself, but there are plenty of laughs in each of them; the extras don't nearly measure up to those you'll find on the Warner releases of the Marxes' later films, and the technical values might not be everything you'd hope for, but these discs are still a blessing, and how that elephant got in my pajamas, I don't know. Amazon Compare

item.title: W.C. Fields Comedy Collection
item.description: From: Universal Studios Home Video - Year: 1933-1940 - Rated: Not Rated - Release Date: November 09, 2004 - Features: Extras! * - Recommended! Five of Fields' best, in reasonably good transfers, with the bonus of a substantial documentary makes this a recommended purchase. Amazon Compare

item.title: The Ranch
item.description: From: MGM Studios DVD - Year: 2004 - Rated: Not Rated - Release Date: November 23, 2004 - Features: DD 5.1 * The Ranch, on its own as a single 90-minute episode, is a frustrating experience. It's a casually watchable (re: predictable subplots, stock character types) primetime soaper set in a legal brothel, boosted by frank language and the occasional bit of nudity, but without the benefit of being able to finish off what it started. Had it survived as a series, it might have been one of those things that hooked you in as a guilty pleasure, but as a standalone film it is unfortunately incomplete. Amazon Compare

item.title: Springtime in a Small Town (Xiao cheng zhi chun)
item.description: From: Palm Pictures - Year: 2002 - Rated: PG - Release Date: November 23, 2004 - Features: Anamorphic * Widescreen * Extras! * - Recommended! Tian Zhuangzhuang's return is a triumphant, patient meditation on love and loyalty. Slowly paced, meticulous visuals create an affecting atmosphere. Palm's release is somewhat disappointing in the a/v department, but contains some fine extras. Amazon Compare

item.title: The O.C.: The Complete First Season
item.description: From: Warner Home Video - Year: 2003-2004 - Rated: Not Rated - Release Date: October 26, 2004 - Features: Extras! * - Recommended! Despite appearances to the contrary - the title, the cast, the sun-drenched locales, and juicy storylines - The O.C. is hardly my idea of a guilty pleasure. Why should anyone feel guilty about watching something so consistently entertaining and smartly written? Season One had its ups and downs, but serialized shows always play better on DVD (no waiting!) and you'll want to be caught up for Season Two, just getting underway (or, of course, for the Season Two DVD set). In the memorable words of one Luke Ward, welcome to the O.C., bit... Well, you know. Amazon Compare

item.title: Cirque Du Soleil: Fire Within
item.description: From: Columbia TriStar Home Video - Year: 2003 - Rated: Not Rated - Release Date: November 02, 2004 - Features: Anamorphic * Widescreen * DD 5.1 * Extras! * - Recommended! Bravo's Emmy-winning Fire Within series gives a rare look at the turmoil, stress, and inner-workings of the Cirque du Soleil in 13 half-hour episodes. This is captivating stuff, and if you have ever seen a Cirque show or DVD (especially Varekai), this is well worth a look. Recommended. Amazon Compare

item.title: The Office: The Complete Collection
item.description: From: BBC Home Video - Year: 2004 - Rated: Not Rated - Release Date: November 16, 2004 - Features: Anamorphic * Widescreen * Extras! * - Recommended! Creators Ricky Gervais and Stephen Merchant deserve tremendous credit for stopping The Office before it lost its steam and became just another sit-com. With only 14 stories produced, there are no bad episodes of this show. Long-running hit series like <a href="powersearch.php3?search_string=friends%3A+the+complete&schoice=1&exact_match=yes">Friends</a>, <a href="powersearch.php3?search_string=loves+raymond&schoice=1&exact_match=yes">Everybody Loves Raymond</a>, and even a personal favorite like <a href="powersearch.php3?search_string=seinfeld&schoice=1&exact_match=yes">Seinfeld</a> can't make that claim. Amazon Compare

item.title: Ike & Tina Turner: The Legends Live in '71
item.description: From: Eagle Eye Media - Year: 1971 - Rated: Not Rated - Release Date: November 02, 2004 - Features: DD 5.1 * DTS * Extras! * The Dutch audience may not have known how good they had it, but on DVD you can check out the Ike & Tina Turner Revue in all its brazen glory. The bonus CD means that you can listen, too, when you're not in front of the television and want to go rollin' down the river. Amazon Compare

item.title: Peter Gabriel: Play
item.description: From: Rhino - Year: 2004 - Rated: Not Rated - Release Date: November 16, 2004 - Features: DD 5.1 * DTS * Extras! * - Recommended! Rarely does a musician come around that is so talented on so many levels. Peter Gabriel: Play is a career-spanning anthology that proves the English superstar's unrivaled gifts as a singer, songwriter, visual collaborator, and peformer. Without question, the best music DVD of 2004. Amazon Compare

item.title: Hero (Ying xiong)
item.description: From: Miramax Pictures - Year: 2002 - Rated: PG-13 - Release Date: November 30, 2004 - Features: Anamorphic * Widescreen * DD 5.1 * DTS * Extras! * - Recommended! Hero (Ying xiong) is one of the most incredible films in a long time. It is both epic and intimate, exciting and contemplative. This DVD from Miramax has a less than stellar image transfer, though Christopher Doyle's cinematography still is stunning to look at. The Mandarin DTS and Dolby Digital tracks are fantastic listens, and there's a English Dolby Digital 5.1 track for those who want to avoid subtitles as well. The extras aren't amazing but are well worth a look. Despite the fact that there will probably be a special edition DVD of this somewhere down the road, it's highly recommended. Amazon Compare

item.title: The Kong Collection (Kong Island & Queen Kong)
item.description: From: Retromedia - Year: 1968, 1976 - Rated: Not Rated - Release Date: November 16, 2004 - Features: Extras! * - Recommended! While Kong Island isn't worth much, Queen Kong is more than deserving of the purchase price. There's a pretty good commentary on the latter disc, though the transfer on both is mediocre. Amazon Compare

item.title: Bobby Jones: Stroke of Genius
item.description: From: Columbia TriStar Home Video - Year: 2004 - Rated: PG - Release Date: November 30, 2004 - Features: Anamorphic * Widescreen * DD 5.1 * Bobby Jones: Stroke of Genius is a well-intended biographical portrait that never fulfills its duty to present a dramatic, entertaining story. This DVD has a very nice image transfer and a pleasant, but dull, Dolby Digital 5.1 mix. The extras are not particularly involving, so this title is more deserving of a rental than a purchase. Amazon Compare

item.title: Bridget Jones's Diary
item.description: From: Miramax Pictures - Year: 2001 - Rated: R - Release Date: November 09, 2004 - Features: Anamorphic * Widescreen * DD 5.1 * Extras! * - Recommended! It's just about impossible not to be charmed by Bridget Jones, and her story here is a sturdy, classically constructed romantic comedy. The three winning lead performances are reason enough to watch, and the grab bag of extras will keep you sated until the sequel comes out on DVD, too. Amazon Compare

item.title: Tru Calling: The Complete First Season
item.description: From: 20th Century Fox - Year: 2003 - Rated: Not Rated - Release Date: November 30, 2004 - Features: Anamorphic * Widescreen * Extras! * - Recommended! She's not quite as grim and ass-kicking as Faith the slayer once was, but Eliza Dushku seems to have made the transition from recurring character to lead player pretty easily and without much fuss. This three-disc set of the first season of Tru Calling?her "I hear dead people" series?builds a bit unevenly as it develops the whole "reliving a day" concept with a set of generally watchable standalone episodes on through a strong second-half-of-the-season story arc concerning more backstory on Tru's murdered mother, as well as the introduction of Jason Priestly to the cast. This is not consistently great television (meaning it is far from being in the <a href="showreview.php3?ID=2801">Twin Peaks</a>/<a href="showreview.php3?ID=5926">Dead Like Me</a> realm) but it is entertaining video junk food, nonetheless, and I like it. With season two still in jeopardy as of this writing, I hope this release spurs a renewed interest that can salvage this show from an unnecessary early grave. Recommended. Amazon Compare

item.title: Ragtime
item.description: From: Paramount Studios - Year: 1981 - Rated: PG - Release Date: November 16, 2004 - Features: Anamorphic * Widescreen * DD 5.1 * Extras! * - Recommended! A well-crafted historical epic, with a bleak outlook for racial justice, and some first-rate extras. The transfer is somewhat dark but otherwise quite good. Amazon Compare

item.title: My Flesh and Blood
item.description: From: Docurama - Year: 2003 - Rated: Not Rated - Release Date: November 30, 2004 - Features: Anamorphic * Widescreen * Extras! * - Recommended! This is easily one of the most compelling and inspiring documentaries in recent memory, a heartwrenching blend of tragedy and love all held together by one remarkable woman. One of the year's best documentary releases, and as such it comes highly recommended. Amazon Compare

item.title: High School Boot Camp
item.description: From: Docurama - Year: 2000 - Rated: Not Rated - Release Date: November 30, 2004 - Features: Extras! * - Recommended! Chuck Braverman's look at a military-style youth boot camp for at-risk teens shows what many considered as a last chance to straighten out their lives. The personal stories are heartbreaking, the regiment of the camp is often disturbing, but seeing the emotional changes that take place is fascinating to watch. Plus, the extras add a deserving coda to some of the cadets featured here, giving closure (good, bad or otherwise). As with just about every Docurama releases, this one is worth checking out if you enjoy documentaries. Amazon Compare

item.title: It's All True
item.description: From: Paramount Studios - Year: 1993 - Rated: G - Release Date: November 30, 2004 An interesting reconstruction of part of the fabled uncompleted Welles film, with an attractive transfer, but I was left wanting much more than the disc provides. Amazon Compare

item.title: Dodgeball: A True Underdog Story
item.description: From: 20th Century Fox - Year: 2004 - Rated: PG-13 - Release Date: December 07, 2004 - Features: Anamorphic * Widescreen * DD 5.1 * Extras! * - Recommended! Dodgeball takes the crudeness of your standard goofball comedy, adds some sharp wit, colorful characters, ballsy competition, and enough quotable lines to keep you and your buddies going for years. This is the funniest movie of the year. As White points out, this lacks the "complexity" of non-American cinema, but here, it's the entertainment that counts. Fox's package is a winner. Amazon Compare

item.title: Luther
item.description: From: MGM Studios DVD - Year: 2003 - Rated: PG-13 - Release Date: November 30, 2004 - Features: Anamorphic * Widescreen * DD 5.1 * - Recommended! Eric Till's attempt at capturing the complexity of Luther's Reformation is technically sound, but struggles to find clarity and glosses over some important dimensions. This film needs room to breathe. Still, it remains an entertaining, informative, and relatively accurate look at these important events. MGM's disc is thin on the extras, but looks and sounds superb. I'm still going to recommended this one. Amazon Compare

item.title: Daredevil: Director's Cut
item.description: From: 20th Century Fox - Year: 2004 - Rated: R - Release Date: November 30, 2004 - Features: Anamorphic * Widescreen * DD 5.1 * DTS * - Recommended! Daredevil: Director's Cut is a mixed bag, being in some ways better and in others worse than the original. The image transfer and sound mixes for this new release don't have any noticeable differences from the original release, except for the DTS sound mix being more juiced up in the surround speakers. The all-new extras are not especially informative in terms of how the film was made, so the original release is preferable in that regard. Recommended for die-hard fans of the comic. Amazon Compare

item.title: The Commish: Season 1
item.description: From: Anchor Bay Entertainment - Year: 1991-1992 - Rated: Not Rated - Release Date: November 16, 2004 - Features: Extras! * - Recommended! My tastes in police series generally have more rough edges than <The Commish, but this series deserves considerable credit for its unconventional lead character. The episodes sometimes follow conventional patterns, but Michael Chiklis always keeps them grounded with his superb performance. If you're a fan of cop shows and are unfamiliar with this one, I suggest at least a rental; it could be a pleasant surprise. Amazon Compare
